questions.question: What does the term 'best' refer to in Best First Search (BFS)?

answers.a: The best path found so far in the search space.
answers.b: The best heuristic function used for evaluation.
answers.c: The best node to expand based on the evaluation function.
answers.d: The best order of exploring nodes in the search space.

questions.question: Which factor influences the efficiency of Best First Search (BFS)?

answers.a: The choice of the heuristic function
answers.b: The size of the search space
answers.d: The initial state of the problem

questions.question: What is the time complexity of Best First Search (BFS) in the worst-case scenario?
Which of the following heuristic functions is admissible in Best-First Search?

answers.a: Overestimating the cost from the current node to the goal node
answers.b: Underestimating the cost from the current node to the goal node
answers.c: Always assigning a heuristic value of zero to all nodes
answers.d: Assigning a random heuristic value to each node

explanations.b: An admissible heuristic function never overestimates the cost to reach the goal

questions.question: Which property does Best First Search (BFS) guarantee to find?

explanations.d: As explained, BFS is neither optimal nor complete. The heuristic function is not guaranteed to be admissible, although it is preferred.
